item.title: 鲍曼称美联储应 "谨慎 "降息
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）重申，她倾向于谨慎降息，并强调潜在通胀率仍 "令人不安地 "高于央行 2% 的目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman reiterated that she prefers to lower interest rates cautiously, emphasizing underlying inflation remains “uncomfortably” above the central bank’s 2% goal.】

item.title: 劳动力市场似乎仍在放缓
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 在上诉法院拒绝阻止法律后，TikTok 面临美国禁令
item.description: 根据联邦上诉法院周五的裁决，如果 TikTok 的中国母公司不能在 1 月 19 日的最后期限前出售该视频分享应用，将面临在美国被禁售的命运。【原文：TikTok’s Chinese parent company faces a ban in the US if it doesn’t meet a Jan. 19 deadline to sell the video-sharing app as a result of a federal appeals court ruling Friday.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心指数与通胀预期同步上升
item.description: 美国消费者情绪升至 4 月以来的最高点，同时，由于民主党人认为预期关税带来的价格压力风险加大，提前一年的通胀预期升至五个月高点。【原文：US consumer sentiment rose to the highest since April, while year-ahead inflation expectations picked up to a five-month high as Democrats saw a greater risk of price pressures from anticipated tariffs.】

item.title: 普京称俄罗斯可能在白俄罗斯部署新型弹道导弹
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京表示，他可能于明年下半年在白俄罗斯部署名为 "奥雷什尼克 "的新型中程弹道导弹。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin said he may deploy the new intermediate-range ballistic missile called Oreshnik in Belarus in the second half of next year.】

item.title: 新华社：中国有 "很大的空间 "来增加财政赤字
item.description: 中国国家媒体称，中国在 2025 年仍有增加借贷和财政赤字的空间，投资者正密切关注中国政府是否会在下周的重要经济会议上动用财政火力为刺激政策加码。【原文：Chinese state media said the country has room to increase its borrowing and fiscal deficit in 2025 as investors closely watch to see whether Beijing would use its fiscal firepower to top off stimulus in its key economic meeting next week.】

item.title: 美国 11 月就业报告的五大启示
item.description: 以下是周五公布的美国 11 月份就业报告的五大要点。单击此处查看我们的 TOPLive 博客：【原文：Here are five key takeaways from the US employment report for November, released Friday. Click here for our TOPLive blog:】

item.title: 加拿大将开设阿拉斯加领事馆以深化美国北极伙伴关系
item.description: 加拿大将在阿拉斯加和格陵兰岛设立两个新的北极领事馆，并任命一位专职北极大使，这是该地区期待已久的战略的一部分。【原文：Canada will establish two new Arctic consulates in Alaska and Greenland and appoint a dedicated Arctic ambassador as part of a long-awaited strategy for a region where Russia and China are increasingly seeking to assert their influence.】

item.title: 赞比亚中央电力公司出售 9,700 万美元绿色债券以扩建太阳能发电厂
item.description: 赞比亚电力供应商铜带能源公司（Copperbelt Energy Corp.【原文：Copperbelt Energy Corp., a Zambian power supplier, issued a $97 million green bond to expand what will be one of the country’s biggest solar plants.】

item.title: Northvolt 创始人与力拓探讨绿色铝厂事宜
item.description: 就在瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt AB 倒闭几周后，其创始人 Vargas Holding 将目光转向了另一个需要清理的能源密集型行业。【原文：Just weeks after the collapse of Swedish battery maker Northvolt AB, its founder Vargas Holding is turning its attention to another energy-intensive industry that needs cleaning up.】

item.title: 英国 NatWest 银行将创 1993 年以来最大年度涨幅
item.description: 随着高利率带来的盈利增长，以及政府准备退出在全球金融危机期间收购的股份，英国贷款公司 NatWest Group Plc 将迎来三十多年来最大的年度收益。【原文：UK lender NatWest Group Plc is poised for its biggest annual gain in more than three decades as lofty interest rates burnish earnings and the government prepares to exit a stake acquired during the global financial crisis.】

item.title: 交易员押注美联储本月减息，国债反弹
item.description: 11 月份就业报告喜忧参半，随后美国国债反弹，交易商也加大了对美联储本月降息的押注。【原文：US Treasuries rallied and traders boosted their bets on a Federal Reserve interest-rate reduction this month after a mixed November employment report.】

item.title: 交易平台 eToro 与高盛合作，计划在美国上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，EToro 正在与高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：EToro is working with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. on a potential initial public offering in the US, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国就业人数从风暴和罢工中反弹，增长 22.7 万人
item.description: 在经历了受风暴和罢工影响的 10 月份之后，美国就业市场在上个月恢复了健康，就业人数的稳健增长有助于缓解对劳动力需求放缓加剧的担忧。【原文：The US job market returned to health last month after a storm- and strike-constrained October, with a solid advance in payrolls helping to temper concerns of a worsening slowdown in labor demand.】

item.title: 中国在绘制神秘幽灵粒子地图的竞赛中击败美国
item.description:
地下深处的巨型球体可能会揭开宇宙的秘密，并巩固中国作为科学超级大国的地位。【原文：

A giant orb deep underground could unlock the secrets of the universe, and cement China’s status as a scientific superpower.

】

item.title: 加拿大失业率跃升至 6.8%，大幅削减失业率的可能性增加
item.description: 加拿大自 4 月份以来的最大就业增幅未能阻止失业率飙升至三年来的最高水平，这可能会增强央行继续加快降息步伐的理由。【原文：Canada’s biggest employment gains since April failed to prevent the jobless rate from surging to the highest level in three years, likely bolstering the case for the central bank to keep cutting rates at a faster pace.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚最高法院下令重新举行总统选举
item.description: 罗马尼亚宪法法院出人意料地下令该国重选第一轮总统竞选，并取消了原定于本周日举行的第二轮决选。【原文：Romania’s Constitutional Court unexpectedly ordered the country to rerun the first round of the presidential race and canceled the second round runoff set for this Sunday.】

item.title: Absa 将改革银行结构，以重新赢得信任
item.description: 作为南非资产规模第三大的银行，Absa 集团有限公司计划在经历多年失误后再次重组业务，以实现增长。【原文：Absa Group Ltd. plans to restructure its business once again as South Africa’s third-biggest bank by assets looks to unlock growth after years of missteps.】

item.title: 波兰利率委员会关系紧张，州长寻求推迟削减利率
item.description: 波兰政策制定者与央行行长亚当-格拉平斯基（Adam Glapinski）关于明年可能不会降息的观点拉开了距离，就在波兰经济放缓之际出现了分歧。【原文：Polish policymakers distanced themselves from central bank Governor Adam Glapinski’s view that interest rates may not be cut at all next year, revealing a split just as the country’s economy slows.】

item.title: 沙特王子告诉 CNBC，欧佩克+推迟反映了 2025 年初的低迷状态
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯能源部长表示，欧佩克+推迟恢复石油生产的决定旨在抵消明年初的季节性需求低迷。【原文：OPEC+’s decision to delay the revival of its oil production was aimed at offsetting a seasonal demand lull early next year, Saudi Arabia’s energy minister said.】

item.title: 市场狂热推动价值 1 万亿美元的 ETF 基金打破年度纪录
item.description: 席卷华尔街的乐观情绪刺激投资者在 2024 年迄今为止向美国交易所交易基金投入了创纪录的 1 万亿美元，为该行业树立了又一个里程碑。【原文：The optimism sweeping Wall Street has spurred investors to plow a record $1 trillion into US exchange-traded funds so far in 2024, racking up yet another milestone for the industry.】

item.title: 调查显示印度家庭对通胀趋势看法不一
item.description: 印度储备银行的调查显示，印度家庭预计从现在到未来 12 个月的通胀率将有所波动。【原文：Indian households expect inflation to fluctuate between now and the next 12 months, according to surveys by the Reserve Bank of India.】

item.title: 在马克龙的反对声中，欧盟达成了寻求已久的南方共同市场协议
item.description: 欧盟和南美洲南方共同市场集团在法国的强烈反对下达成了一项长期寻求的贸易协议。【原文：The European Union and the South American Mercosur bloc clinched a long-sought trade deal over the vehement objections of France, which has pledged to lead a charge to obstruct its ratification.】

item.title: 美国 11 月份就业报告分析
item.description: 一名工人在宾夕法尼亚州伊利市的一家制造厂焊接住宅栏杆。摄影师：Jared Wickerham/Bloomberg【原文：A worker welds a residential railing at a manufacturing facility in Erie, Pennsylvania. Photographer: Jared Wickerham/Bloomberg】

item.title: 亿万富翁勒菲弗赢得意大利法院裁决，结束家族纷争
item.description: 邮轮亿万富翁曼弗雷迪-勒菲弗-德奥维迪奥（Manfredi Lefebvre d'Ovidio）在意大利最高法院的裁决中胜诉，从而结束了一场旷日持久的家族财产纠纷。【原文：Cruise billionaire Manfredi Lefebvre d’Ovidio won an Italian supreme court ruling set to end a long-running dispute over the family fortune.】

item.title: 气候技术风险投资人突然会说特朗普的语言了
item.description:
该行业正在使用与当选总统一致的流行语，强调能源独立和创造就业机会。【原文：

The industry is using buzzwords that align with the president-elect, emphasizing energy independence and job creation.

】

item.title: 特朗普的海湾交易商帮助家族在房地产热潮中套现
item.description: 要想了解特朗普组织在中东的商业野心，齐亚德-埃尔-查尔（Ziad El Chaar）是不二人选。【原文：To get a sense of the Trump Organization’s business ambitions in the Middle East, look no further than Ziad El Chaar.】

item.title: 5000 亿美元大单引发华尔街被动争议
item.description: 被动投资的巨轮正在加速前进；它在整个华尔街激起了对指数追踪热潮所带来的危险的新忧虑。【原文：The passive-investing juggernaut is picking up speed — and it’s stirring up fresh angst about the dangers posed by the index-tracking boom across Wall Street.】

item.title: 钻石销售下滑，博茨瓦纳面临 2020 年以来最严重的经济衰退
item.description: 博茨瓦纳财政部长恩达巴-高拉特（Ndaba Gaolathe）表示，由于该国的主要出口商品钻石销售长期低迷，博茨瓦纳今年的经济可能萎缩1.7%。【原文：Botswana’s economy may contract by 1.7% this year due to a prolonged downturn in diamond sales, the country’s primary export commodity, Finance Minister Ndaba Gaolathe said.】

item.title: LG 电子是测试印度飙升的 IPO 市场的最新企业
item.description: 总部位于韩国的 LG 电子公司印度分公司申请首次公开募股，这是外国公司在南亚国家蓬勃发展的市场上寻求投资者的最新举措。【原文：The Indian unit of South Korea-based LG Electronics Inc. filed for an initial public offering, the latest among foreign companies looking to tap investors in the South Asian country’s booming market.】
